params.text:
• Give information in a simple way
  • Request information on names and dates
  • Ask for confirmation on phone numbers

Telephone

Exchange simple information

Language in Action
Telephone: Introduction
Today you will learn how to share basic information on the phone.

1. Give information in a simple way:
    Practice sharing simple details about yourself or something else.

  2. Request information on names and dates:  Learn how to ask for someone’s name or a specific date.

  3. Ask for confirmation on phone numbers: Practice checking that you have the correct phone number.
Give Information In A Simple Way: Flashcards

dialogs.answer:
Use this to say your name.
Example: My name is John.

Use this to say your job.
Example: I work at Hartford Trading.

Use this to say what you like.
Example: I would like to speak to John Phillips.

Use this to say what you have.
Example: I have a question.

params.text: Information In A Simple Way: Listening & Quiz
Please listen to the following conversation and answer the questions below:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Abigail: Hello Anthony, how is the project going?

Anthony: Hi Abigail, it's going well. I have a team of five people.

Abigail: Great! And what are you doing now?

Anthony: We are working on the design. I like the new colours.

Abigail: That's good to hear. When do you think you will finish?

Anthony: I think we will finish in two weeks.
Dialogue Text:
Anthony:
Abigail:

params.text: Request information on names and dates: Flashcards

dialogs.answer: Use this to ask someone their name.
Use this to ask someone to spell their name.
Use this to ask someone their family name.
Use this to ask the date of a meeting.
Use this to ask what day it is.
Use this to ask the date.

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: What does Micah want to confirm with Bryan?
answers:
The date of the meeting

The time of the meeting

The place of the meeting

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: What does Bryan ask Micah?
answers:
The day of the meeting

Micah's phone number

Micah's surname

metadata.title: Request information on names and dates Conversation Quiz

params.text: Please read the following conversation and answer the questions;

Micah: Hello Bryan, it’s Micah.

Bryan: Hi Micah. How are you?

Micah: I’m fine, thanks. Can we confirm the meeting for next week?

Bryan: Yes, of course. What day is it?

Micah: It’s Tuesday.

Bryan: Tuesday? Can you spell your surname please? I want to check my calendar.

Micah: Yes, it’s M-I-C-H-A-H.
Ask For Confirmation On Phone Numbers: Flashcards

dialogs.answer:
Use this to repeat the number and ask for confirmation.
Example: Is that 01234567890?

Use this to ask for the number again.
Example: The number is...?

Use this to politely ask for the number again.
Example: Can you repeat the number, please?

Use this before repeating the number to check it.
Example: Let me write that down. Is it 01234567890?

Use this if you didn't understand the number.
Example: Could you spell the number?

Use this if you didn't understand the number.
Example: Sorry, I didn't get that. Could you say the number again?

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: What does Bryan want to confirm?
Question 2 of 3: What does Abigail do to help Bryan?
answers:
She gives Bryan her phone number.

She hangs up the phone.

She repeats the phone number.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: How does Bryan check the phone number?
answers:
He writes it down.

He memorizes it.

He asks someone else.

metadata.title: Ask For Confirmation On Phone Numbers Conversation Quiz

params.text: Ask For Confirmation On Phone Numbers: Listening & Quiz
Please listen to the following conversation and answer the questions below:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Bryan: Hello Abigail, it’s Bryan.

Abigail: Hi Bryan, it’s good to hear from you.

Bryan: Yes, it’s good to talk to you too. I wanted to confirm the office number.

Abigail: Yes, of course. It’s 01234567890.

Bryan: Let me write that down. Is that 01234567890?

Abigail: Yes, that’s correct.

Bryan: Great, thanks.

Abigail: No problem.
Dialogue Text:
Bryan:
Abigail:
Ask For Confirmation On Phone Numbers: Quiz
Read the following situations and choose the best answer:

choices.question: Question 2 of 4: I didn't _____ that. Could you say it again?

metadata.title: Ask For Confirmation On Phone Numbers Quiz

params.text: Module Summary Quiz
Test your instruction-following skills! Choose the BEST answer for each question to show what you learned in this module.

choices.question: Question 1 of 6: How do you introduce yourself on the phone?
answers:
Say your name and a greeting.

Ask for the other person's name.

Ask for their phone number.

choices.question: Question 2 of 6: Which phrase is used to ask for someone's name?
answers:
What is your name?

What is your job?

Where do you live?

choices.question: Question 3 of 6: How do you ask for someone's surname?
answers:
What is your last name?

What is your first name?

How old are you?

choices.question: Question 4 of 6: How do you ask for confirmation of a phone number?
answers:
Is that 01234567890?

What is your address?

Can you speak English?

choices.question: Question 5 of 6: How do you ask for the date of a meeting?
answers:
When is the meeting?

What time is it?

Where is the meeting?

choices.question: Question 6 of 6: How do you give your age on the phone?
answers:
I am 25 years old.

I live in London.

I like pizza.
